column5: Hi all, hope you all had a wonderful Xmas and have begun the recovery process  We had a wonderful Xmas, although i pulled night shifts xmas and boxing day, still managed lots of fun...and even some fishing with family and friends.   Jack is now 3 months away from his 3rd birthday....and while last year he kinda got the whole xmas thing...this year he totally got what it was about.....it was the best feeling in the world to see his little face light up opening presents, the excitement in his voice all day, the look of disbelief and joy when he was allowed to eat candy and chocolate at will in large amounts...priceless.    Here are some pics from xmas and boxing day.............                                                              Hope you enjoyed those....now i have 4 days of work...then 2 days chasing Lakers and Whitefish!!!!!  Happy new year to you all,  Simon.
That was awesome Simon looks like a great Christmas for your family
That right there is what Christmas is all about Simon
by far the best pic is of Jack holding the candy bar as big as him with a bite out of it...
Great pictures Simon.  I got the same snowmobile for Paul.  Ralphie could almost ride on it, but he's a bit too big now  Now all we need is some snow!  Merry Christmas and Happy New Year
The pics of Jack, smiling and full of glee, just warm my heart. On the other hand, the icefishing pics are burnin my britches!!!!
LOL Simon that Pic of Jack with the choclate bar.....Priceless..  Great times my man!!
